review:
I started out with a recommendation from a friend, saw that it was over 4 stars in total reviews, didn‚Äôt look any deeper than that. I got overexcited and pumped about grand in, saw the numbers grow and was loving it. Yes the ID verification seemed a bit odd but it did work. Adding a credit card to feed the account worked. Adding a bank account (Halifax) to feed the account worked after doing the SEPA transfer (again, felt a bit weird, but worked).

Then I try and make a withdrawal. It doesn‚Äôt work. It seems my Halifax account isn‚Äôt actually validated. Cue me delving into the reviews on here and feeling a sense of dread as I really can‚Äôt afford to lose the grand I‚Äôve put in! I see lots of people in the same situation, saying scam.

Not good. BUT Reddit to the rescue. They put me on to Revolut - an account (with an app) that can deal in Euros. So I figure what have I got to lose? Downloaded it, set it up, did the SEPA to Coinbase (2 to be sure ‚Ç¨2 and ‚Ç¨10) and it worked! Said it was verified in the web version of Coinbase as well. That‚Äôs only half of it though, tried a withdrawal ‚Ç¨10 to test it, 2 days later it‚Äôs in Revolut converted it to GBP, one day later it‚Äôs in my account. That was it, removed the grand, it‚Äôs in my account as of today and the profits are left in Coinbase.

I‚Äôm putting this up to hopefully help any of the others that were in the same situation as me. I get you‚Äôd be skeptical at this point, I WAS. But give it a go. Revolut has taken what would be a 1 Star review to 4

review:
I‚Äôm a new Coinbase user and I have recently discovered that there is literally NO customer service for this company. All there seems to be is simply an online report form which you‚Äôre meant to fill out in order to receive a ‚Äúreach out‚Äù by email from some Coinbase representative. 

It‚Äôs been 1 week and so far NOTHING, and I‚Äôm STILL under account restrictions which Coinbase arbitrarily imposed on me without any warning, notice or explanation.

I think I probably tried to convert my cryptos too many times and they just arbitrarily restricted my account from buying or converting cryptos, even though I am a fully verified user. However, it appears that I can still sell and transfer my Coinbase funds to my bank account, which is why I‚Äôm giving this review a two star rating instead of just one. Nonetheless there are plenty reviews about this app by those who claim that they cannot even do this, which is more than a little disconcerting.

Also the transaction fees on Coinbase are completely outrageous bordering on the extortionate. 

At first glance most of Coinbase‚Äôs Apple reviews appear to be good, but just going down the list they all seem to be polar opposites - either very good reviews or very bad, which suggests to me that Coinbase is somehow manipulating its own reviews.

I haven‚Äôt used Kraken yet but I‚Äôve heard very good things about it as far as their customer support is concerned, and I have noticed that Kraken appears to have attempted to address every review that is posted about them. I think I‚Äôll try Kraken instead.
title: Non-Existent Customer Service

review:
I opened an Account, went through verification, linked 2 Debit Cards and completed a number of trades. Next thing my 3D Secure Purchase  buying limit and PayPal buying limits were set to ¬£0. No reason, no explanation, just stopped me in my tracks. 

Called Customer Service to hear they had a 10 hour wait time! 

Called again the following day, hours of wait time but then heard they have a call back facility, so did that and about 8 hrs later I got a call. They just couldn‚Äôt understand the fact that my limit was ¬£0, just kept saying I have all the appropriate features available. They are clearly using a script and try and match your issues with a limited menu, as they settled on the reason for my call was to request an increased limit. However, they cannot do this so will escalate it to a team that will review ‚Äòmy request‚Äô‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.

Nothing changed days later. Called again to resolve, exactly the same response! 

It‚Äôs now been well over a week, calls, emails and still they haven‚Äôt made any effort to resolve this for me.

I just can‚Äôt understand why this has either happened or why they just can‚Äôt resolve it for me. 

It‚Äôs a shame as it‚Äôs an easy site to understand and use, but for me - pointless! They‚Äôve lost a new customer as I‚Äôve taken my business to various other exchanges now and have moved all bar 2 of my assets out. 

The reality is that not being able to use them hindered progression and lost investment. 

Sort it out Coinbase‚Ä¶ please !!
title: Awful Exchange and Customer Service experience!

review:
It's very easy to exchange your crypto currencies to GBP/USD/EUR but we just trade for their company.
3% hidden fee when you buy/sell/convert 
Think if you start with ¬£100 BTC from your pocket then convert to ETH then sell the buy again then finally sell it and get your money to your pocket 
3% first buy + 3% first convert + 3% first sell + 3% second buy + 3% last sell = 
15% fee and all is hidden. 
5 trade = 15% fee
3%+3%+3%+3%+3%=15% fee

Can you understand how many % chart must move to have some profit ?

It means if you are happy with 5% movement on each trade 
And if all movements were as your expectation and you think ok I'll have 5 times 5% =25% profit, you are absolutely wrong because on each trade you have to pay 3% hidden fee.
So Coinbase will have 15% profit but you will have 10% profit. 
You will have ¬£10 profit and Coinbase will have ¬£15 profit.

This calculation was just if as if you trade true and movements were as your expectation.
But if you trade on bad moments and you loss (for example each trade 5% loss)
After 5 wrong trade 
you will loss : 25%    -¬£25 
Coinbase will profit same all time
3% profit on each trade 
Coinbase profit ¬£10

Imagine in the world Millions of transactions are in progress every day.

Millions 3% profit every day
3% of just 10 millions is ¬£3,000,000 profit every day
¬£3,000,000 each day without doing nothing and they still want get more and more by deleting "Price Option" from their app to take traders awareness about prices.

Shame on you.

This is an opportunity for all people around the world not just for hungry people like you.

review:
I opened an account with Coinbase last year and found it very easy to use.
All of my deposits were very quickly received and I was able to purchase bitcoin, Ethereum and Litecoin.
I was happy with the bitcash arrangement and all was good.

However, I decided about a month ago to set up a withdrawal in case I needed to draw off any profits.
However, despite having added my U.K. bank account it didn‚Äôt appear in the withdrawal section.
Coinbase instructions are to deposit a small amount from your U.K. bank account into Coinbase and this creates a link.
It doesnt.
I‚Äôve done it twice now (bank fees ¬£9 each time) and it doesn‚Äôt work.

If you try to contact Coinbase you have to go through the ‚ÄòAdabot‚Äô (which is useless for anything other than very simple problems).
I sent an email to Coinbase 2 weeks ago and still haven‚Äôt heard back.

If you want to turn your money into Crypto‚Äôs then I would recommend Coinbase, but if you want to take it back into national currency at any point in the next two months then don‚Äôt bother.

Up until a month ago I‚Äôd have given this app 4 stars - but now I would say 2 stars is being generous...

Coinbase have replied to my email about the money withdraw matter - after about 6 weeks of waiting - and have FINALLY added my U.K. (Lloyds) bank account.

However I can‚Äôt test whether or not this works as the only way I was able to extract my money was to transfer my entire Coinbase fund out into my own digital wallet (very easy to set up).

The rest of the Coinbase operation (as I have already stated) was excellent - so this incredibly poor bit of their service has completely let them down.
title: Coinbase pros and cons

review:
I have had this app for over  a year and have made multiple purchases for different  crypto‚Äôs last year my account was randomly blocked during a price rise in bitcoin it was not just my account but multiple individuals as seen on social media and various forums. Coinbase came out and said there was an error. My account is verified at level 2 and I have submitted my ID‚Äôs as I‚Äôve stated  previously my account HAS ALREADY BEEN VERIFIED FOR OVER A YEAR AND MY ACCOUNT HAD BEEN BLOCKED WITH NO EXPLANATION AT ALL!!!!!!!!!

This bull cycle AGAIN my account has been blocked I have been asked AGAIN to verify my account over a week now I am unable to use my account withdraw any of my funds or move my crypto.

A SIMPLE SEARCH ONLINE NOT ONLY SHOWS THAT MULTIPLE OTHER USERS HAVE BEEN EXPERIENCING SIMILAR THINGS.  What makes this even more disgusting is the fact that Coinbase has NO CUSTOMER SERVICE . You have to fill in a form you cannot speak to anyone directly via email or phone there is virtually NO OTHER FORM OF CONTACT other than the preallocated drop down options on their website . ONCE CONTACTED YOU GET an auto template response (I have verified this)  or they will assure you that the issue is fixed in a given timeframe (24/48h) CLOSE THE SERVICE TICKET WHICH YOU ARE NOW UNABLE TO RESPOND TO. This is disgusting 

I HAVE NOW OPENED 3 tickets for this issue as the first 2 has been closed yet my account is still frozen ‚Äúpending review to be verified‚Äù the last contact I received was 

‚Äú Thank you for following up with us about your account review.

Our team is still working on the review and we don't have any additional updates at this time. We will let you know as soon as we are done with the review and have additional information.‚Äù

please Note the bold text. Now my money is frozen and I am unable to do anything for over a week.

NO ONE SHOULD USE THIS SERVICE
UNLESS YOU ARE OKAY WITH YOUR MONEY BEING FROZEN IN A BULL RUN.

 I WISH I DID A SEARCH ONLINE TO VERIFY BUT SOOOOO MANY OTHER USERS HAVE THIS PROBLEM WITH COINBASE,  SOOO MANY.
please do not see this as a personal lash out 
DO RESEARCH ONLINE BEFORE YOU CONSIDER USING THIS APP. You will see for yourself. I hope no one else experiences this. I will spread this experience and all
Their responses to me on every platform possible . No one should experience this  it is a MASSIVE SHAME because this app was my first introduction to crypto.
title: DO NOT USE THIS CRYPTO EXCHANGE

review: First impressions are that the the app is sound and allows you to track your accounts and wallet on your mobile.  Careful reference to the website reveals more detail and although the charges are mentioned they are difficult to understand as the amount charged seems to differ from the percentages quoted.  That said the charges are clearly displayed as part of the transaction.  Advice would be to establish the payment and transfer process in both directions with small amounts before being surprised.
title: A Newby

review: I use coinbase regular for BTC purchases so have a credit and debit card stored with them. I noticed a while back, transactions coming out of my bank account from Coinbase that I recognised but were like weeks ahead of when I made that purchase. Today, I was out overdrawn by a transaction taken from Coinbase and was called by my bank. Upon very close inspection, it was a duplicate withdrawal. And this had happened a few times! I contacted Coinbase via the app and sent them the references attached to each bank account withdrawn and I was immediately issued a refund without and explanation. I have now taken off m stored card data and will no longer use Coinbase for purchases. They seem to have the best prices around on the Internet for BTC but not when they're taking extra money from you without you realising.
title: Keep a close eye on your bank account

review: Want to buy etherium . I can get Bitcoin elsewhere. This app barely functions on iPad. It's taken two weeks on and off to set it up ,continually verify email addresses,send photo ID( which the website still asks for even after accepting it on the app) . Pop up keypads block the forms that you're trying to fill in and are only got rid of by clearing the app from iPad and trying again...to no avail as the same thing happens everytime "Live" help.....is another computer even tho you click a box asking you if you want to speak to a human being..after finally completing everything the app demanded ..it would only let me buy "Bitcoin" If I switch to the ether wallet it asks me to start all over again with the ID verification and adding payment methods. Probably the worst programmed app I have ever ever used.
title: Useless

review: Trading something like Ether it is key to have a reliable app and web version. Unfortunately both have been down for a long time with no fixes even though the status pages have hinted it was all fixed... this has meant missed opportunities. I would recommend looking for a more reliable app and service than Coinbase if you're looking to trade regularly or make the most of a quick sell for profit.
title: App hasn't worked for 12+ hours

review:
So many hidden fees and i read all the FAQ and didn't see anything about not being able to withdraw into sterling, I found out from the other reviews.
 
The price they give you when purchasing any currency is false and ether was about ¬£4 more per coin before fees. 

The app is basic and doesn't have much functionality, their security measures have many bugs and issues, was quite the pain to setup at first.

Support is totally useless as it is an automated system that sends you the most relevant link 

Not many functions in this app, id recommend using browser atleast it shows the portfolio total! And I don't know about buying ether but I'd advise buying bitcoin elsewhere.

Millions have been invested into this company by others and they make this crap
title: So many hidden fees

review:
This app is simple to use but unfortunately that just makes it a front to a company with poor service delivery and bad customer services. 

Any large fluctuations in crypto prices and the Coinbase infrastructure hangs (we'll assume this is due to load and nothing more sinister). Once you finally get verified I find putting money in very easy but getting it out is another matter. 

For those of us in the UK there is no longer a way of connecting your bank account and withdrawing in GBP. Coinbase have allegedly been trying to fix this for 18 months with no sign of a resolution. I am no longer using Coinbase to invest in Crypto and would not suggest them to others.
title: Decent app but woeful service

review: Coinbase is a fantastic place to get your feet wet in what is otherwise the confusing World of Crypto. I tend to use the website for transactions but the app is perfect for keeping track of my crypto and checking on the BTC/ETH/LTC charts. I really like the fingerprint login and I can also keep track of my BTC vault. Coinbase, we hear of shady hackers stealing currency all the time. Please add ETH and LTC vaults. This will only serve to encourage more people into Crypto, if they feel their coin is secure.
title: Superb App

review: I have always been a fan of coin base for being able to buy BTC instantly. Although they charged pretty steep fees of around 4-5% per purchase I don't usually mind because they arrive instantly. However in the past week or so I have not been able to buy Bitcoin once due to errors with the website and app. I have tried numerous times to no avail. The customer support of coin base is absolutely awful too with Twitter and email being the only way to contact them yet they have completely ignored my direct messages and emails for around 3 days now. Shocking for a company of this size. I would not recommend unless it is your only option.
title: Coinbase...

review: Coinbase isn't a bad way to buy cryptocurrency and it's rated are reasonable. However, you cannot invest very much even after verification as they set very low limits (though I've read they will rise gradually). More importantly, you might have trouble with certain transactions. I sold ether and proceeds went into my local currency wallet (GBP). I wanted to use it to buy other currency but even though the proceeds are in my wallet, the balance shows as ¬£0.00 when trying to buy, so some sort of bug. Also, nearly impossible to withdraw GBP so am a bit stuck. Probably a poor app choice for the UK.
title: Some buggy flaws

review: It's really a shame. The platform look like one of the most simple to buy and sell, but the app doesn't work at all. After that the card and the id has been verified, if you try to go on buy the screen doesn't work at all, it keeps swiping automatically between the verification view and the buy view. I've been able to press the button "buy" just one time and it didn't work as well showing error messaging without any useful meaning so at the end i gave up i've deleted my account. It's strange that a business of this kind can release an app like that, it seems that has never been tested.
title: Not good

review:
The app is simple, the dashboard and your accounts is all I need. The service (Coinbase) is also good, perhaps a bit expensive on fees, but I've done many transactions now without problem. The security procedures in place appear to be well done and useful.
As someone in the UK it is annoying you have to go via Euros to withdraw fiat currency, but I understand that is a regulation thing.
title: Simple app, good service

review: All these bad reviews and I have not had 1 problem with the app since I downloaded it about 5 months ago only seen improvements in the updates. Maybe the cheap phones they are using why the app is crashing?  Anyway, I would like to see an update where the Bitcoin price is displayed on the front of the app without opening it.
title: Great app

review:
Spot on app.  Integrates seamlessly with online account etc. So easy to use and no crashes. Perfect.

I have no idea why so many bad reviews, I have BTC, ETH, GBP and EUR all in one app and it's quick and slick.

Only thing I'd like to see, is what blockchain app does, and show the Bitcoin address its sent / receiving from, and amount of confirmations, rather than just saying pending.  Other than that, 10/10

Oh and also, my master card doesn't support 3D security nor does my bank account support SEPA, so can't buy using app.  I had to use a business account and they charged me ¬£9.50fee for sending ‚Ç¨5, mental, if you can fix that, that would be a touch.
title: That's more like it!

review: Initially when signing up for about 5 minutes I couldn't trade but considering I'm brand new to this whole thing my patience was a little more extended. Now my app works great and the simple user face makes it a lot easier for a novice like me to get around. Just wish they had push notifications when the price reaches a certain low/ high. That would be perfect
title: User friendly and efficient

review: I have used this app for just over a month now and have been able to use it with ease. As stated In a previous comment you would need to have your account registered to the country of your nationality, once done it is very easy to navigate and use with external sites.
title: Easy to use and prompt customer service

review:
App works well and very easy to follow. The customer service is minimal and given this is a cash based investment you want to know how to convert bitcoins into your base currency.

It's not easy and you will incur currency charges if outside of the US. I am Uk based investor and spend ¬£6 converting back to sterling each time. Not too bad but not referenced anywhere!
title: Good but beware of withdrawing cash

review:
As a purchase platform it is ideal. 

The credit restrictions are also a good fail safe. Using pound weighted averaging or buying frequently in smaller amounts leads to buying in the dips and highs leading to longer term stable growth if you use Cryptosporidium as an investment model.

The operators have been upfront on Bitcoin Cash and won't trade it, so stable currency management seems a good goal
title: Clear straightforward

review: The App is very well made, looks like it's a joy to use once you have it working. But you see, that's the problem right there. getting it to actually work! I have tried adding a bank card to my account and it's saying that the CVV is incorrect and that the verification has failed despite it being correct. This is very frustrating, hopefully they will fix this soon with an update. Aside from that the app gave me a good first impression.
title: Drew

review: The app itself looks great and easy to use, unfortunately i'm not able to verify my account because i live abroad and my ID doesn't match the country the app is set to. I've contacted customer service to get it fixed two weeks ago but still no answer, a real shame!
title: No costumer service

review:
Quite surprised to see positive reviews go online and see online reviews abut this scam .. yes I am happy with it too but have you ever tired to withdraw your money ? 
If not try it it's absolutely impossible there are funny feelings going on abut it you can pay but you can't withdraw without verifying and doesn't matter how many time you verify it's still not possible.
And I've send millions of emails but no response and they don't have any help line so make sure you don't get scammed .. 
I am stuck with 7k and can't withdraw so please be careful before it's too late
title: IT SEEMS SCAM

review: Had it a week or so now. Never had any issues with app opening. Verification set up was a bit tricky on my desktop but the online chat support was excellent. The fee for paying into my GBP account seems crazy high (¬£2.91 on ¬£100 but that shouldn't be a reflection on the quality of the app.
title: Works perfectly for me

review: Have contacted them multiple times to increase my buying allowance and had no reply. It's been weeks and the max I can buy is ¬£50 worth despite going through all the verification processes! Looking to take my funds out and migrate to another wallet.
title: Poor customer service, low buying limits

review: Had this app for a long time and it always crashes when loading, during the point it was getting data from the server, this problem fixed it self when I got my iPhone 5s unlocked to any network :s don't know why that happened... The reason I gave it a 3 star and not a 4 star is because when you buy Bitcoin it does not tell you your wallet amount on that screen,..
title: Decent app

review: Completely unusable. After logging the app crashes. There on when launching the app it just crashes. I've not been able to use the app at all. Judging by the other reviews it's a long running issue that has never been fixed.
title: App crashes on load

review: Coinbase is a good app for getting you started in the world of crypto's. it's a little frustrating it takes so long to build up the instant purchase limits but it gets there in the end. Overall would recommend for new starts in crypto currency's
title: Good app

review:
I've seen a lot of negative reviews, some even stating that Coinbase is a dubious setup. However their statements do conflict with the T&Cs of using it as a wallet. 

However the app functions smoothly and can be relied upon, as with anything there is room for improvement and I suggest that people learn to use technology and even grasp the concept of Bitcoin and its uses before criticising.
title: What's the issue?

review: This app, and Coinbase in general, frustrates. They appear overwhelmed and cannot handle enquiries in a speedy fashion. And they must have a lot of enquiries to handle because their system is terribly flawed. Uploading ID for verification can take 20 attempts. Accounts frozen for no good reason. Terribly low limits for buying and selling.  And just yesterday I bought $500 ETH. The purchase was 'pending' for two hours, and then cancelled. By which time the ETH price had gone up 10%. There are many better apps and sites than Coinbase!
title: Looks Good Works Bad

review:
Very simple to use
Not bad rates
Could do with offering more coins
Biggest issue is it's hugely difficult to cash in coins for fiat & I suspect hugely expensive too. This really holds it back and alerts seem to have stopped working! And don't expect to ever get a response from customer service
title: Good until you want to cash out

review:
The app is simple and does all it really needs to. It clearly displays your balances and transactions, and makes buying and selling crypto currency easy.

There's still room for improvement, however. Some of the support pages are outdated, and no longer reflect what you see in the current app, such as adding a new bank account.
title: Simple and effective

review:
I tried another app to buy bitcoin but my debit and credit card were both knocked back.
I read a couple of reviews online and downloaded this app on my iPhone and managed to buy bitcoin first attempt.
title: Easy to set up

review:
No option to limit-buy; I think this is deliberate so that Coinbase make money off the back of people through the difference when not buying with limit. 

No buy max button on the phone app, so you have to enter numbers with trial and error thus wasting time and price can go up/down. 

Card transactions work 1/50 attempts. 

Customer support is less existent than a script, pointing you to the same useless FAQ.

The problem is that Coinbase knows that they are the only platform that offer and app, hence increasing the quality on any aspect is optional.
title: Worst platform dealing with money

review: Well designed, easy to use even for newcomers to the,sometimes, hard to grasp world of crypto. Fast deposits and most importantly fast withdrawals. I have never had an issue with Coinbase and would recommend them to all.
title: Quality App

review: I've bought Ethereum, Bitcoin and Litecoin without issue. My only gripe so far is the notifications for increases and decreases either don't work or are so late that they're worthless. Sort that out and you'll get 5 stars from me
title: No complaints so far

review:
Please for the sake of your money, do not use this app. Coinbase are notorious for their customer service and if anything happens to your accounts or if you have difficulty withdrawing, you will never hear from them. Have spent weeks attempting to get my money back but their customer service has sent nothing back.

They are notorious amongst exchanges and wallet services for being completely untrustworthy. Use anything else.
title: Terrible service, do not trust with your money

review: Must have app, your own bank in your pocket, lets use this technology to our advantage, thank you coinbase keep working on upgrades, it can only get better, I want to be part of the team
title: Information Age

review:
Simply the best bitcoin app and service I have used.

It would be nice if I could buy bitcoins with my UK bank account without having to make international transfers but I gather this is due to the nasty banking regulations trying to control my money üò°. Bring on the bitcoin revolution!

(Top app üëç)
title: Best for Bitcoin

review:
Yea it's great. Read all the other reviews. 
Please add a TRACKING only section for other currency in the dashboard. I would like to see my entire collection in one place. No trade...  that's fine just tracking. Thanks fir great app
title: Track other currencies

review: One of the best IOS wallets if not the best. Does everything you need from a mobile wallet. Read all the online recommendations before using any online wallet and never keep any great amount of value on it.
title: Great app

review: I'm leaving this review as I'm hoping they will fix the app. Currently I can't buy any bitcoins as the 3D secure screen doesn't populate. Any purchases I try to make show as pending and then cancel a few hours later. If I use the website it works fine. Please sort the 3D secure payment for debit/credit cards as with this not working you can't buy coins via the app.
title: Used to work well...

review: Probably the buggiest app I've ever used - it can't make up it's mind what page it thinks you're on, and input fields just randomly change for no reason. It would have been vaguely useable, except that after adding my card it tells me I have a ¬£0 daily limit. Great. What even is the point of this app? Don't waste your time downloading, there are better solutions out there that actually work!
title: Buggy, and unable to trade

review:

review:
Not a bad app. It would be good if the app was updated to have the following:

- 3m period for viewing historic data
- turning the device on its side should show the price graphs full screen
- display a more detailed breakdown for each transaction (e.g. Display the fees charged)
- show an overall profit or loss figure across all wallets taking into account the fees
- offer the ability to hide wallets on the home screen
- allow selection of a default currency rather than always going to bitcoin
- add price alerts for litecoin

review:
The app is very buggy and given that these people will be holding money for you it's worth thinking twice whether to use them. As others have mentioned:

1: very difficult to withdraw cash. Even after you go through the convoluted process of setting up a withdrawal account (which takes about 5 days), after a couple of weeks my account was simply deleted for no reason meaning I had to reopen another withdrawal account (again 5 day wait). Note that unless you have a withdrawal amount you cannot (!) get your money out of the platform. This means you may find yourself in a situation where you need to sell urgently, and Coinbase tells you to wait 4-5 days. High risk! 

2: there is no customer service. All get you is an automated bot and an email address which appears completely unmanned. I've sent them a couple of emails, it's been weeks and no one has responded. If something critical were to happen (e.g. a hack) you would be stuck with no help.

3: their currency wallet system is completely faulty. I ve been given a EUR wallet despite being in the Uk. No way of changing  it within the app. You contact them - no response (see point 2). This means every time you transfer money you get hit with exchange rate and foreign transfer fees. 

4: lastly the app is generally quite buggy. Regular crashes and bugs aside, the other day all my accounts reduced to Zero suggesting that my money was gone (!). In these circumstances - as explained - you have no one you can call or contact, you're just stuck not knowing what to do. Luckily in my case the accounts reset to their original values after about 30 minutes - again no idea what caused it and will never know.

All in all - I recommend staying away and finding a different provider. You're dealing with real money here so think twice if you want to take the risk.
title: Beware: lots of issues

review: Don't make my mistake and invest before realising YOU CANT WITHDRAW TO UK BANK ACCOUNTS.

review:
Not even a Karen review, I had ¬£2500 in Crypto on Coinbase, holding for long term investment and they didn‚Äôt like that. 

Spread between about 75 currencies, I kept my coins sitting in there dormant, Coinbase decided to close my account with no notice and when asked about it, they said ‚Äúdue to company regulations and privacy policies, we are unable to share our reasons for your account closure‚Äù. They gave me a landing page with the option to transfer out my funds, but there was a minimum amount required in order to transfer, as my finances were spread across multiple coins, some didn‚Äôt meet the thresholds I lost about ¬£600 from this closure and was never given a legitimate reason. 

Moved over to Crypto.com and wouldn‚Äôt look back.
title: AVOID LIKE THE PLAGUE!

review:
I found that it was a good application but I outgrew it dabbled into other coins like Pepe which is Available on regulated competitors like crypto.com. It‚Äôs a shame that they don‚Äôt list notable meme coins like Pepe that have other 2 billion dollar market caps. This season is different. People don‚Äôt want chainlink, Ethereum and Bitcoin - it‚Äôs meme coin season and I feel that Coinbase is completely out of touch. If they do update their listings and add Pepe then I will definitely consider adding assets to Coinbase.

Also, when I tried to withdraw money from Coinbase they put a 3 day delay on my withdrawals to other wallets. I submitted my verification over 20 times correctly to speed up the process and it didn‚Äôt work. In conclusion, coinbase doesn‚Äôt allow the freedom to assets to move easily defeating the point of crypto currency. 

As a result I lost out on some very lucrative trades.
title: They don‚Äôt list Pepe - small selection of coins.

review:
So I recently regained access to my Coinbase account that I never used in the past. And I started to remember why I didn‚Äôt move forward with investing there the last time‚Ä¶How is possible that Apps these days still work in such old fashioned way? Jumping from app to browser all the time. Anyway, my issue was something as simple as updating my phone number‚Ä¶as the one attached to my account I don‚Äôt have it, and no way to receive authentication code by email, or app. User Interface is terrible. 

But my surprise was even bigger when I tried to get support to update my phone, again poor user experience, trying to sort it out by myself with the articles related but no luck, I turned in to Customer Support, fancy bot, not a chance to get someone to help, or my problem fixed. Again, I just needed to update my phone number, nothing fancy‚Ä¶
title: Wow!

review: Extortionate fees apply when buying and selling. If you put in ¬£20 you would be charged ¬£2 to buy and ¬£2 to sell left with ONLY ¬£16! A con use other places like crypto.com
title: Use others, Coinbase is a con

review:
This is a bit of a con. Had the account a while and now need to verify my details (which I don‚Äôt wish to do, hence the cryptocurrency) now can log in and move my money out of Coinbase! Plus, over priced KuCoin or Crypto.com is better you can bank transfer into Crypto.com for 0 fees (apart from your standard bank transfer fee - no 2.99%) and they have way more options.

Years later and it‚Äôs still rubbish
title: Con

review:
Can you please remove the banner at the top of the app which is permanently on the screen? It‚Äôs very intrusive and I haven‚Äôt found any way to get rid of it. 

It warns Coinbase customers that unless we‚Äôre prepared to loose all our money, which is highly unlikely to happen, granted the price of some cryptocurrencies can fluctuate significantly or just fail, Bitcoin specifically, has, since its release to the world in 2009 and was worth less than $0.01, to now at the end of 23 being worth $43,561.60 performed rather well I would say! So app developers, please can you remove it, being in the UK, I‚Äôm aware of the FCA and their requirements, and I‚Äôm well aware of the associated risks! Thank you x
title: Good, but‚Ä¶

review:
I have traded shares, etf‚Äôs etc for years in ISA and SIPP and also hold spread betting accounts. I wanted to try bit coin so went to the most famous provider of it. In summary trading bitcoin through Coinbase in the UK is not fit for purpose. 

After filling out numerous questionnaires, photographing my driving license, setting up 2FA and waiting for the cooling off period you can finally buy. 

However my purchase was limited to ¬£100/card ¬£300 per week. I want to invest ¬£10k and at that rate it would take me 34 weeks to get the money in! 

Their website/app states limits can be as much as ¬£10k/transaction if by bank transfer but they don‚Äôt allow you to set up bank transfers and quote fca limits/risk etc. 

Also they charge ¬£3.84 on the ¬£100 transaction which is 3.84%. Same to sell so to buy and sell will cost you 7.68%!

I called about increasing the limits and was told they can request it but don‚Äôt know if you will get it, when it will be reviewed and you need to provide photo of ID which has already submitted and approved and also a selfie photo. A quick internet search indicates everyone has very restricted limits and that limits go up and down for now apparent reason. 

Lost interest at this point and closed the account and will go elsewhere. 

Don‚Äôt waste your time. A ¬£300/week limit to buy bitcoin with ¬£100/200 card limits and fees of ¬£3.84 is simply not fit for purpose.
title: Awful

I like crypto.com it‚Äôs more fun and easy to use. But Coinbase has a lot of information which will be if it you long run.

review:
I lost the phone I use for this account and went through the process of changing it.  It said an email would be sent when it was ready and it would be 06:30am at the latest.  It still reverts to the old phone number for my text code when sending crypto, so I can‚Äôt send anything out of this account at the moment!
Very frustrating since I went through the ID passport photo and selfie on the ID check app and it was confirmed.
title: Changed phone number‚Ä¶ big problem!

review:
I have been using Coinbase for 3 years (both App and website). At first I felt the CB user interface was slicker and more user-friendly than any of the rivals. That is no longer the case. They have stood still while other CEX‚Äôs have moved a long way forward.  CB fees can also be high compared to some others.
I recently had reason to contact CB Customer Service over a problem I experienced making a crypto deposit into the CB platform. An incorrect QR code on CB resulted in the loss of my coins. Customer Service is extremely slow at responding and simply fobbed me off at every attempt to seek a remedy. They accept no measure of responsibility (either technical or moral) for the consequence of their error. CB claim to be the most trusted exchange. Not a chance‚Ä¶‚Ä¶!  If I can‚Äôt trust a deposit QR code they produce, then I figure I can‚Äôt trust anything at all in their App or website.
And if something goes wrong, expect no actual support, conscience or remedy from Customer Services (if you get a timely answer at all, that is!).
Please be warned.
title: Customer service is terrible

review:
The app is phenomenal in providing real time crypto updates,  but adding funds is difficult in the UK. Some banks do not like it or allow it.

But recently my funds appeared in Coinbase as ‚Äòpending‚Äô and remained so for a week.  Customer service said I would receive an email but have been waiting 5 days for that. Funds are still stuck.

Therefore it is unreliable when trying to move funds to capitalize on market trends. 

For those at Coinbase marketing it is case number 14484370. Please address promptly.
title: Great app, terrible customer service

review:
STAY CLEAR OF COINBASE.

They are NOT who they say they are.

review:
What a difference a year makes.
 
Just 1 year ago, Super Bowl LVI was awash in expensive, star-studded commercials for companies like Cyrpto.com, eToro, FTX, and Coinbase, and the cryptocurrency revolution seemed ascendant. 
If you were a typical football fan who put $1,000 into Bitcoin from the couch mid-broadcast on February 13, 2022, you‚Äôd have $540 right now.

Looking back at the Coinbase Twitter, not a month goes by without an apology for some service mishap. Here‚Äôs a couple‚Ä¶ Dec 15 2021 ‚Äú We are aware that some customers are having issues accessing Coinbase. We are actively working on the issue and will post an update soon.‚Äù Followed by a fix. Then‚Ä¶ Feb 4 2022 ‚ÄúAs our teams work to restore full service, Coinbase.com and the mobile app may have trouble loading and you may see error pages. Rest assured your funds are safe, and we're working hard to resolve.‚Äù Again, the problem is eventually resolved. But. Why are things so‚Ä¶..flakey?

review:
I have been using the app for few months and Coinbase has a bit expensive transaction fees comparing to another competitors, but the user interface is very friendly specially for those who are starting their crypto journey and I would probably give it 4 stars for that, however, after having an issue with a transaction delay and contacting the customer service, I received a very generic response that it‚Äôs the blockchain fault and I just have to be patient without giving me specific timeframe of when Coinbase will resolve the issue. That unfortunately caused me a financial and client credibility loss and when I elevated it to the complaint department, they came back to me a week later saying they can see the issue was resolved and the complaint officer decided from himself there is no need to investigate and closed just the ticket. After I replied I am not happy they close it without even looking at the impact it caused me after it took them 14 hours to resolve the issue, of course I got no response. Luckily the issue doesn‚Äôt worth wasting my time in chasing them as the number wasn‚Äôt huge, but definitely I will not trust them again for big transactions. If you want use Coinbase I suggest to limit your use and pray to not have any issues that require you to deal with the customer or their complaint department. Horrible experience.

Update: in summary, my issues are not only with the delayed transaction that took 14 hours not up to 1 hour as advertised by Coinbase, but also with the customer service and the way how it was handled by the complaint department. Complaint case #12307057 FYI.

review:
I‚Äôve noticed big errors on orders within Coinbase. Particularly with the swapping between assets function and transfers out to other wallets.

Errors on orders? For example, a little trade <¬£20 showing as ¬£47K+ within the history... That was for a swap and just an example, not actual figures. But very close.

Then I noticed error‚Äôs showing when transferring Ada out to another wallet. Trade value <¬£300 but showed on the account as ¬£394 on the transaction. Can this be looked at? How will this be fair when it comes to my taxes? 

It‚Äôs either something needs fixing regarding the trades on my account and an audit needs to be done/corrections made OR it‚Äôs just because the Coinbase app is not recognising that ADA under GBP, on Coinbase, got turned into USD upon the transfer onto the ADA network? 

That would mean your app is reading actual USD values as GBP, showing incorrect figures. It‚Äôs a shame your website doesn‚Äôt allow users to report these types of bugs, meaning I‚Äôve had to leave a concerning review for new users to read. I just hope things check out on paper, as you can imagine.

Please note I experience these issues with setting GBP as my native currency within my portfolio.

review:
Since the latest ‚Äúoverhaul‚Äù...

 The charts are pure nonsense, they‚Äôre under reporting your ‚Äúportfolio balance‚Äù by about a ¬£1000 and are lagging about an hour behind real time. (The ‚Äúchart‚Äù bares no comparison to the written ‚Äúportfolio balance‚Äù above it. - ie my balance might have been ¬£14,000 at 1pm and ¬£15000 at 2pm,  the chart will however  read ¬£13,000 at 1pm and ¬£14,000 at 2pm, lagging and ¬£1000 too low) 

Your written ‚Äúportfolio balance‚Äù doesn‚Äôt refresh, unless you click on an individual asset, to force an update of that asset, which then forces a portfolio update. 

 The ‚Äúcharts‚Äù fail to accurately report the correct highs / lows of the previous 24hours / week / month etc. This is a major problem that wasn‚Äôt there before the overhaul. 

Prices of coins don‚Äôt refresh unless you click on them individually. A real pain if you‚Äôre tracking 20 assets. 

The useful ‚Äúsell 1/2, 1/4‚Äù features are gone and only ‚Äúsell max‚Äù remains. Meaning trying to do calculations in your head. Easy for 1 asset, not so easy to avoid mistakes when trying to sell half your holdings of 20 different assets as quickly as possible during momentary spikes in price. 

Why is the ‚Äúprices‚Äù section over run with prices for assets not even tradable on Coinbase? It‚Äôs a colossal waste of time sifting through pointless data to get to actual tradable asset prices. There is a ‚Äútradable asset‚Äù list but I only want ‚Äútradable assets‚Äù in the ‚Äútop gainers‚Äù and ‚Äútop losers‚Äù lists, not another 50 crypto prices I have no interest in and can‚Äôt trade anyway. Shift ‚Äúnon tradable assets‚Äù into a separate category and leave all the other categories purely for tradable assets. 

The ‚Äútop gainers‚Äù / ‚Äútop losers‚Äù list are constantly filled with wrong data. ie assets in the ‚Äúgainers‚Äù list that have LOST 10% and vice versa.

‚ÄúNotifications‚Äù are useless. Other apps let me set EXACT, and multiple, price alerts for any individual asset. (Eg a text alert when Ethereum hits ¬£1351.78976) General ‚Äúthe market is up 5%‚Äù alerts are worthless. 

App still crashes at periods of high trading. 

The app has major flaws and the latest overhaul made them all much worse.

review: Initially took only small trades to test the platform. I am on level 2 trading, so I am ID checked and bank a/c checked.    Found that the best way to fund the account is direct from my bank a/c with individual code added on any payment... trading is easy and refunds to my bank a/c is virtually instantaneous... charges add up .. but it‚Äôs the same for any trading platforms.
title: Easy and Quick

review:
-Pros: Trade in ¬£, ‚Ç¨ or $, Correlates market, User friendly, Setup is easy, Easy Payments, Good to Fair security.

-Cons: Fees Extremely High, Price Lags Frequent, Buy Prices Hidden, Lack Of Assets, Old Out of Date News, Bad Custom Price Alerts, Service/Payment Issues, Hidden Fees.

I‚Äôll explain the cons... I‚Äôve been using this app for a month now. Maybe longer but this what I can say so far.

FEES are too high for instance to deposit ¬£80 they‚Äôd charge ¬£2.99 just in fees an asset worth ¬£80 will put you in a loss instantly. Once ready to sell get ready for another ¬£2.99 charge almost guaranteeing you not to make a profit.

PEICE LAGS are an issue on coinbase because the price you see on assets are sell price not buy price. Buy prices are shown only in preview of transaction just before buying it. When markets volatile I am instantly checking the buy prices and it‚Äôs a havoc as I‚Äôd try to buy the asset and the preview will pop up. Keep looking and cancelling until I‚Äôm satisfied to go in at right price. 

LACK OF ASSETS. All trade-able assets add up to about 18 most of them aren‚Äôt good and they have about 2/3 more like DASH, BSV, BTC Gold for some reason I cannot trade in the U.K. Those are Region based.

OLD NEWS. I expect some good up to date news at-least 15-20 articles daily. This helps us predict the market keeping us up to date with crypto‚Äôs without having to download a separate app. As of now there are 8 news articles and the latest one is 8 hours ago honestly. 

PRICES ARE HIDDEN. Assets like Chainlink,  only show a few digits of the actual price. For instance. If it‚Äôs worth 2.856840 to sell coinbase will only show 2.85 or 2.86 and nothing more price so it‚Äôs difficult to get the exact figures and you will need to pretend sell to get the exact amount which is usually lower.

RUBBISH PRICE ALERTS. They have only 3 assets you can set custom price alerts for BTC ETH LTC out of about 18-20. Some of the alerts setup don‚Äôt go off at the right time. 

EARN/LEARN program. I‚Äôve been on the waiting list for their ‚Äúearn while you learn‚Äù program which gives you small crypto‚Äôs for learning about them. Wait can be up-to a year and some people saying they‚Äôre accepted instantly? 

To anyone looking to use the app. Please be careful as it‚Äôs easy to lose out especially if you don‚Äôt look to hold assets for too long and want to move them around. Don‚Äôt panic and Good luck. 

To coinbase. Thanks for the app and platform but please update the app and I will change my review upon improvements. Some of these features will increase the amount of satisfied customers. I.e. Up to date News, Custom Price Alerts For All Assets, Show full Chainlink Prices. Show Together Buy/Sell Rates.

Things to consider are FEES! 
You charge way too much for too little amount and this is why many people that are STARTING UP (first timers, beginners, etc) on crypto will instantly stop using you.

I hope this helps everyone.
title: TERRIBLE FEES, FUTURES AND FEATURES

Who ever has problem withdrawing money from coinbase. Download an app called ‚Äúrevolut‚Äù and make an account in that app. Than topup some money from your bank into revolut app and send it to coinbase through bank transfer option in the app. The minimum is about ¬£1.20. 
So when the coinbase will receive your money maximum in two working days. They will link your revolut account with coinbase and than you can withdraw to revolut in euro currency and convert into gbp within the revolut app. After that either use your money through revolut or again bank transfer it in to your daily use account.

review:
Coin base is the most useless app I have ever used in my life. 

First and foremost, customer experience is utterly ridiculous.

I can‚Äôt believe SEC will consider an app like this a currency trading app.

I made a deposit with my card but can‚Äôt withdraw back to the card.

I attached my UK bank information which I had to deposit money again into their Euro account and was still charge ridiculous amount for that yet can‚Äôt withdrawal to my UK bank account.

The functionality call to action buttons  ‚ÄúDeposit and Withdrawal‚Äù are confusing as they don‚Äôt actually do what is expected 

I tried to log in online now the 2-Step Verification code sent to my phone over 30 mins ago is yet the pass code text is not delivered.

There‚Äôs not real phone number, email or real person behind their life chat. 

So do the expect customer complaint to be solved. 

This is too ridiculous to be a currency trading app.

I am totally disappointed in this rubbish company and it‚Äôs app. 

I suggest no one should use this useless app again. 

Companies like this should not be accepted as a financial company

I just don‚Äôt understand how they pass the vetting process

Anyways I want my money back ASAP cos I‚Äôm sick and tired of this app that lacks features meet customer‚Äôs needs and customer experience.
title: This app is rubbish

review:
Worst trading app. Cannot withdraw in GBP. Had to transfer between GBP back to BTC and in to Euro for me to then have to make a deposit to confirm my bank in euros, incurring bank charges. So basically to withdraw ¬£46 its cost ¬£13.98.
EDIT:
Still no joy. Customer service is non existent and my money is locked away in there system with no means of retrieving. I did try to reinvest in BTC when it was $1000 but that couldn‚Äôt be done. Don‚Äôt waste your time, try someone else.
title: Do Not Use

review:
Coinbase make it easy to get into bitcoin but once you are doing it for a while you realise they are charging way more than other competitors.  Bitcoin is always 200-300 dollars more expensive on here!

Also whenever it gets busy the website crashes meaning you miss out on selling and buying.. costing you money. Happens way too often!!

Coinbase when you sell search the market for the cheapest rate for them to buy back at top and sell it to you at the largest with their fees. Would recommend doing your research and buying elsewhere.

Have a problem? There customer service is non existent. Takes them over 4-7 days to respond to you. Their live bot is useless.

Real improvements to be made.  Wish I knew this info before signing up.
title: Expensive fees higher than competitors and unreliable

review:

When you try on a different device you have to verify device. Coinbase send you a text with a code that you enter. You enter the code then you are send a email to your email address. The email doesn‚Äôt arrive to you email address I turned off my spam settings but nothing still arrives. 

So frustrating
